item.title: Sam add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "Growth for the sake of growth is the ideology of the cancer cell." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Sam add a quote by Isaac Newton
item.description: "I do not know what I may appear to the world, but to myself I seem to have been only like a boy playing on the sea-shore, and diverting myself in now and then finding a smoother pebble or a prettier shell than ordinary, whilst the great ocean of truth lay all undiscovered before me." -- Isaac Newton

item.title: Sam add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Sam add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Let silence take you to the core of life." -- Rumi

item.title: Sam add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We have to continually be jumping off cliffs and developing our wings on the way down." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sam add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut, Jr
item.description: "Dear future generations: Please accept our apologies. We were rolling drunk on petroleum." -- Kurt Vonnegut, Jr

item.title: Sam add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I have hated words and I have loved them, and I hope I have made them right." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Sam add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Like most misery, it started with apparent happiness." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Sam add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Sam add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Sometimes people are beautiful. Not in looks. Not in what they say. Just in what they are." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Sam add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Don't let the bastards grind you down." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Sam add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "I would like to be the air that inhabits you for a moment only. I would like to be that unnoticed and that necessary." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Sam add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Saying 'I notice you're a nerd' is like saying, 'Hey, I notice that you'd rather be intelligent than be stupid, that you'd rather be thoughtful than be vapid, that you believe that there are things that matter more than the arrest record of Lindsay Lohan. Why is that?' In fact, it seems to me that most contemporary insults are pretty lame. Even 'lame' is kind of lame. Saying 'You're lame' is like saying 'You walk with a limp.' Yeah, whatever, so does 50 Cent, and he's done all right for himself." -- John Green

item.title: Sam add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "What I want is to be needed. What I need is to be indispensable to somebody. Who I need is somebody that will eat up all my free time, my ego, my attention. Somebody addicted to me. A mutual addiction." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Sam add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The things you used to own, now they own you." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Sam add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "I want out of the labels. I don't want my whole life crammed into a single word. A story. I want to find something else, unknowable, some place to be that's not on the map. A real adventure.' A spinx. A mystery. A blank. Unknown. Undefined." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Sam add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Did perpetual happiness in the Garden of Eden maybe get so boring that eating the apple was justified?" -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Sam add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Sam add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Sam add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Sam add a quote by Jimi Hendrix
item.description: "I'm the one that's got to die when it's time for me to die, so let me live my life the way I want to." -- Jimi Hendrix

item.title: Sam add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask what’s for lunch." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Sam add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "I love sleep. My life has the tendency to fall apart when I'm awake, you know?" -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Sam add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "He can run faster than Severus Snape confronted with shampoo." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Sam add a quote by J.K. Rowling
Sam add a quote by Amanda Cross
item.description: "A literary academic can no more pass a bookstore than an alcoholic can pass a bar." -- Amanda Cross

item.title: Sam add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Sam add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "It never got weird enough for me." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Sam add a quote by Plato
item.description: "I'm trying to think, don't confuse me with facts." -- Plato

item.title: Sam add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description: "What you seek is seeking you." -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
